body_content.explanation: a situation in which people agree or have the same opinion:
examples: It will be difficult to get any sort of statewide concurrence.

body_content.explanation: a document in which someone writes that they agree with a legal judgment:
examples: Justice Alberto Gonzales, who later served as White House counsel, wrote a concurrence.
A 1995 concurrence by Thomas is now required reading in some law school courses.

body_content.explanation: a situation in which things or events happen or exist at the same time:
examples: The concurrence of these events was very exciting.
We want to ensure the concurrency of design and planning tasks.
